Job.JobDescription: Assistant Volleyball Coach - 0.5 FTE - Wilsonville High School This position is for 2026-2027 School Year. Start Date: 08/17/2025. Work with the head coach in developing skills, techniques, and strategies for competitive volleyball; monitor student development and academic progress. Instructs players in the rules, regulations, equipment, and techniques of volleyball. Organizes and directs individual and small group practice activities/exercises. Assesses player's skills. Monitors players during competition and practice. Determines game strategy. Supervises athletes during practices and competition. The coach shall have completed the annual online required trainings as well as other West Linn-Wilsonville employment requirements. Community and District Information: The West Linn-Wilsonville School District is nestled within two thriving cities, West Linn and Wilsonville, within the rural area of Clackamas County. Both communities have a strong legacy of support for their schools, music and arts endeavors, and the overall well-being of their patrons. The school district and surrounding communities have experienced steady, constant growth over the past three decades. The estimated student population of the District as of December 2024, is 8,900. It is the policy of the West Linn-Wilsonville Board of Education and School District (WLWV) that no discrimination or harassment on the grounds of race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veterans' status, genetic information, or disability shall occur if the employee with or without reasonable accommodation, is able to perform the essential functions of the position. These protections apply to students, employees, and other members of the public. West Linn-Wilsonville School District is committed to equal access and equal opportunity in all activities/services, educational programs, and employment. Persons having questions regarding equal opportunity and nondiscrimination should contact the Director of Human Resources at the West Linn-Wilsonville School District, 503-673-7095. Job.JobTitle: Head Boys Tennis Coach - Cleveland HS - 25/26 SY - District Athletics
Job.JobDescription:
Posting Timeline This job is open until filled. Applications will be reviewed as received. Portland Public Schools reserves the right to make a hiring decision at any point during the posting period.
Position Details DISTRICT MISSION: At PPS, our goal is that by the end of elementary, middle and high school every student by name is meeting or exceeding academic standards and is fully prepared to make productive life decisions. DISTRICT PROFILE: To obtain more information about our district, schools, learning environment and programs, please go to https://www.pps.net/Domain/265. Key points of the job description for a Varsity Head Coach: High ethical and professional standards. Direct a successful grade 9-12 program and oversee all facets of an entire community youth program. 3 years of High School coaching experience Be a role model for high school student-athletes. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports by encouraging student-athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program. Lead student-athletes in the support of other Portland Public Schools athletics and activities.
The Head Coach will be responsible for the following: Manage all aspects of the high school program including training, practice schedules and routines. Hire and oversee a staff of assistant coaches Provide regular communication with parents/families Regularly track the academic progress of all student-athletes in the program and facilitate necessary supports to ensure their academic eligibility. Cooperate with other school-sponsored sports and encourage athletes to compete in other programs. Develop and implement an off-season program for athletics.
All new hired coaches will need to complete the following prior to employment: NFHS/ASEP Certification First Aid Card (CPR and AED trained) District Fingerprinting/criminal check Completion of OSAA Concussion Test Completion of ODE Steroid Test Completion of OSAA Heat Test *Head Up Football *Cheer and Dance/Drill Spirit Safety Training Completion of Portland Public School District paperwork and trainings.
Applicant will be asked to apply online at our website and include the following: A cover letter detailing your experience. A current resume. A minimum of three letters of recommendation/reference.
All PPS job offers are contingent on the satisfactory completion of a background check, including fingerprinting and criminal records.
Salary Range - $6100.00 to $10,000.00 * There is no compensation for summer and out of season workouts.

* There is no compensation for summer and out of season workouts.
Portland Public Schools (PPS) is seeking talented people from diverse backgrounds and experiences to lead change and inspire PPS students. At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. With the District’s focus on eliminating systemic racism and its adverse impact on student learning, we seek to hire individuals who bring to our district a deep commitment to racial equity and social justice.
The District is committed to equal opportunity and nondiscrimination in all its educational and employment activities. The District prohibits discrimination based on perceived or actual race; national or ethnic origin; color; sex; religion; age; sexual orientation; gender expression or identity; pregnancy; marital status; veteran’s status; familial status; economic status or source of income; mental or physical disability or perceived disability; or military service.

At PPS, every employee, despite having different roles, is an educator. We hope to attract talented educators who model the core PPS Educator Essentials. With the District’s focus on eliminating systemic racism and its adverse impact on student learning, we seek to hire individuals who bring to our district a deep commitment to racial equity and social justice. The District is committed to equal opportunity and nondiscrimination in all its educational and employment activities. The District prohibits discrimination based on perceived or actual race; national or ethnic origin; color; sex; religion; age; sexual orientation; gender expression or identity; pregnancy; marital status; veteran’s status; familial status; economic status or source of income; mental or physical disability or perceived disability; or military service.

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - Head Coach - Football role at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.Location: PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract – PMS - HEAD Coach - Girls Soccer follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.
Job.Location: PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL - West Chester, Pennsylvania
Job.CompanyDescription: West Chester Area School D. coaching jobs

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a key leadership role within the school's athletic program and wider learning community. This long-form description is designed to give prospective applicants a clear view of the expectations, responsibilities, and culture that surround the role. Coaches in this position are trusted to model character, support academic success, and help student‑athletes grow through meaningful experiences in practice, competition, and daily school life.
In this role, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer works closely with the athletic director, school administrators, and other coaches to design and maintain a structured, developmentally appropriate program. That includes planning practices that blend fundamental skill instruction, competitive drills, and situational teaching so athletes understand both the technical and strategic sides of the game. The coach is responsible for teaching core skills, reinforcing proper technique, and helping athletes safely build strength, conditioning, and sport‑specific endurance.
The position also focuses heavily on culture and leadership. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL sets the tone for effort, respect, and sportsmanship. This involves building clear expectations for behavior, guiding athletes through wins and losses with perspective, and maintaining standards that reflect the values of the school and community. Student‑athletes should come away from the program with improved confidence, stronger communication skills, and a better understanding of teamwork and accountability.
Another important part of the job is collaboration. The coach regularly communicates with teachers, counselors, and families to help student‑athletes balance athletics with academics and other responsibilities. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, athletic participation is viewed as an extension of the classroom rather than a replacement for it. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer encourages students to stay organized, meet eligibility requirements, and pursue long‑term goals in the classroom as well as on the field or court.
Program operations also fall under this role. The coach helps manage equipment, uniforms, and facilities, and assists with scheduling, transportation coordination, and adherence to league and district policies. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer is expected to understand and follow all relevant regulations, including eligibility rules, sportsmanship guidelines, and safety standards, while maintaining current certifications such as CPR/First Aid as required by the district.
Finally, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Boys Soccer position at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is a visible role that represents the school within the larger community. The coach interacts with families, officials, visiting teams, and youth programs, modeling professionalism in every setting. Candidates who are passionate about teaching, committed to student growth, and prepared to invest time and energy into the long‑term health of the program will find this role both challenging and rewarding.

Job.JobTitle: 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey
Job.JobDescription:
The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL is designed for a coach who believes that athletics is a powerful tool for teaching life skills. This role centers on developing student‑athletes as people first and competitors second, helping them learn responsibility, perseverance, and teamwork in a structured and supportive environment. The program places a strong emphasis on clear communication, mutual respect, and long‑term development rather than short‑term results alone.
On a daily basis, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey is responsible for planning and delivering practices that are active, safe, and inclusive. Training sessions should include a balance of fundamentals, decision‑making drills, and live or game‑like situations so that athletes are constantly learning. The coach provides direct instruction, demonstrates proper technique, and offers individualized feedback to help each athlete progress from their current skill level.
In addition to technical coaching, this position carries significant mentoring responsibilities. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches are expected to build positive relationships with student‑athletes and to support them through the challenges of school, competition, and adolescence. That means listening carefully, encouraging good choices, and reinforcing expectations related to attendance, academic effort, and personal conduct. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey helps create a team environment where athletes feel valued and where they understand that their actions affect the group.
The role also includes collaboration with the broader athletic department. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey works with the athletic director and other coaches to coordinate facility use, align program philosophies, and support multi‑sport participation when possible. Sharing information, attending department meetings, and contributing to school‑wide initiatives all help ensure that the program at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL operates smoothly and consistently from season to season.
Game‑day responsibilities include preparing athletes physically and mentally, organizing lineups, communicating adjustments, and modeling composure in competitive situations. The coach is expected to represent PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL with professionalism toward officials, opponents, and fans. After competitions, the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey reviews performance with the team, highlighting effort, improvement, and areas for growth.
Health and safety are a constant priority. The coach follows district and state guidelines for equipment use, conditioning progressions, and emergency response. Maintaining appropriate certifications and staying current with best practices helps ensure that every training and competition environment is as safe as possible for all participants. Candidates who care deeply about student development, enjoy teaching the details of the sport, and are committed to a positive, educational approach to athletics will be strong fits for the 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - ASST. Coach - Field Hockey role at PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL.

The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At PEIRCE MIDDLE SCHOOL, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The 2026-2027 (Fall) Supplemental Contract - PMS - HEAD Coach - Field Hockey follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Job.JobDescription: Position Summary: The Head Coach for Girls Flag Football is responsible for leading and developing a competitive, educationally grounded, and character-driven athletic program at Erie High School. The Head Coach will foster positive communication and collaboration among Erie Public Schools, student-athletes, families, and community partners. This individual is expected to promote academic excellence, sportsmanship, and good citizenship while serving as a positive role model and mentor in alignment with PIAA Girls Flag Football standards. Term of Employment: Seasonal � PIAA Sanctioned Sport 12-month position School / Location: Erie High School Reporting Relationships: Reports directly to the Director of Athletics and the Building Principal. Qualifications: - Prior coaching experience in Girls Flag Football, football, or a related sport preferred - Thorough knowledge of PIAA bylaws and NFHS Girls Flag Football rules - Demonstrated ability to plan and implement effective practice plans and competitive strategies - Strong organizational, leadership, and communication skills - Ability to motivate, mentor, and develop student-athletes both athletically and academically - Experience working with urban student populations preferred - Ability to support and transition student-athletes to the next competitive level - Working knowledge of Erie Public Schools policies and procedures - Must obtain and maintain required FBI, PA Criminal, and Child Abuse Clearances PIAA / NFHS Compliance & Expectations: The Head Coach must demonstrate a thorough understanding of and strict adherence to all Pennsylvania Interscholastic Athletic Association (PIAA) bylaws, policies, and regulations, as well as all National Federation of State High School Associations (NFHS) Girls Flag Football rules. The Head Coach is responsible for ensuring that all aspects of the Girls Flag Football program�including practices, competitions, athlete eligibility, conduct, safety protocols, and coaching behavior�are fully compliant with PIAA, NFHS, and Erie Public Schools requirements. The Head Coach must: - Maintain current knowledge of PIAA bylaws and NFHS rule updates - Complete all required PIAA, PDE, and NFHS coaching education and sport-specific certifications - Enforce rules related to eligibility, transfers, practice limitations, and seasons of participation - Model and promote sportsmanship and ethical conduct in accordance with NFHS standards - Ensure student-athlete safety through proper supervision and adherence to NFHS safety guidelines - Cooperate fully with the Athletic Director and Building Principal on all compliance matters Failure to comply with PIAA or NFHS regulations may result in disciplinary action, up to and including removal from coaching duties. Essential Duties and Responsibilities - Supervise and instruct student-athletes in compliance with NFHS rules and PIAA regulations - Plan, organize, and conduct practices, games, and competitions - Monitor and support academic eligibility, attendance, and conduct of student-athletes - Ensure all athletes are properly cleared, rostered, and eligible - Maintain accurate records, inventories, and equipment control - Ensure all uniforms and equipment are accounted for prior to stipend disbursement - Communicate effectively with athletes, families, and District administration - Promote safety, sportsmanship, leadership, and positive character development Off-Season Responsibilities - Participate in and support program fundraisers, as applicable - Attend or organize off-season camps, leagues, and development opportunities - Organize and supervise off-season open gym and weight room sessions - Develop off-season practice plans and instructional programming Professional Expectations The Head Coach will represent Erie Public Schools with the highest standards of professionalism, ethical conduct, and integrity at all times. Other Duties - Attend staff meetings, clinics, and professional development activities - Perform other related duties as assigned by the Athletic Director, Building Principal, or other administrator Evaluation Performance will be evaluated by the Director of Athletics and/or the Building Principal. This list intended to be illustrative rather than complete and serves to show major duties and responsibilities and does not express or imply that these are the only duties performed by the incumbent in this position. The employee will be required to perform any other position-related duties requested by the supervisor.
Job.Experience: Prior coaching experience in Girls Flag Football, football, or a related sport preferred
Job.CompanyDescription: Erie City School District coaching jobs

The Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach at Manheim Township is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Manheim Township reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Varsity Assistant Baseball Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Manheim Township. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

The Coach - Girls Volleyball, Assistant Coach (Fall) position at HIGH SCHOOL provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Coach - Girls Volleyball, Assistant Coach (Fall) prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At HIGH SCHOOL, the Coach - Girls Volleyball, Assistant Coach (Fall) works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Coach - Girls Volleyball, Assistant Coach (Fall) encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Coach - Girls Volleyball, Assistant Coach (Fall) at HIGH SCHOOL is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Job.JobTitle: Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach
Job.JobDescription:
The Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach at HIGH SCHOOL is an integral member of the school's educational team, using athletics as a platform for teaching discipline, teamwork, and perseverance. This position calls for a coach who is organized, reflective, and committed to continuous improvement, both for themselves and for their athletes. The role blends hands‑on coaching with program administration and relationship‑building.
From a coaching standpoint, the Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach is responsible for teaching the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport in a way that is accessible to student‑athletes. Practices are planned to include progressive skill work, position‑specific instruction, and opportunities for athletes to apply learning in controlled scrimmage situations. The coach pays attention to pacing and variety so that sessions remain engaging while still challenging students to stretch their comfort zones.
Culture is a central focus of this job. At HIGH SCHOOL, the Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach helps create a team environment where respect, honesty, and effort are expected. The coach sets clear standards regarding communication, attendance, and sportsmanship, and works with athletes to understand why these standards matter. When expectations are not met, the coach responds fairly, explaining consequences and encouraging athletes to learn from mistakes.
The position also requires responsiveness to student needs. Coaches remain aware of the emotional and academic pressures students face and adjust support accordingly. Checking in with athletes, acknowledging their efforts, and partnering with school staff all contribute to a positive experience. The Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach may assist in connecting students with resources when additional support is needed.
Outside of direct coaching, the role involves tasks such as coordinating with officials and opponents, assisting with scheduling, and managing team communication channels. The coach must be punctual, prepared, and detail‑oriented, ensuring that events run smoothly and that the team represents HIGH SCHOOL well at home and away.
Safety remains an ongoing responsibility. The Coach - Girls Flag Football, Assistant Coach follows district guidelines, maintains necessary certifications, and emphasizes proper warm‑up routines and technique to minimize risk of injury. This comprehensive approach to coaching allows student‑athletes to pursue their goals in a structured environment that prioritizes learning, well‑being, and long‑term success.
Job.Experience: previous coaching at the high school level

Job.JobTitle: Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions)
Job.JobDescription:
The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) at Avon Grove Middle School is a comprehensive coaching assignment where teaching, organization, and care for students come together in a single role. The coach is expected to be prepared, professional, and consistent, creating a framework in which athletes understand what is expected of them and feel supported in meeting those expectations. The program thrives when the coach brings a balanced focus on performance, safety, and personal development.
During practices, the Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) manages time efficiently, moving athletes through warm‑ups, skill stations, team concepts, and competitive play. The coach provides instruction and feedback that is specific and actionable, helping athletes understand not just what to do, but why it matters. Attention is given to fundamentals, conditioning appropriate to the sport and season, and mental preparation for competition.
The position carries a strong responsibility for modeling behavior. At Avon Grove Middle School, coaches are role models whether they are on the sideline, traveling with the team, or speaking with families. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) demonstrates composure, fairness, and respect, even in emotionally charged situations. Athletes observe and imitate these behaviors, so the coach’s example has a direct impact on team culture.
The role also involves building strong connections with the broader school community. The coach collaborates with staff members, responds to communication from parents and guardians, and participates in department or school events as appropriate. Being visible and approachable helps families feel confident that their children are in a safe, supportive program.
Safety and compliance requirements form an important foundation. The Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) follows all district and league regulations, maintains necessary certifications, and ensures that facilities and equipment are used appropriately. Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the Middle School Girls Softball Coach (2 positions) at Avon Grove Middle School allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Job.JobTitle: Head Junior High Field Hockey Coach
Job.JobDescription:
Job Goal: This position involves coaching, mentoring, and guiding student-athletes in individual skill development and team strategies. The coach will also be responsible for fostering a positive and inclusive team culture, ensuring the safety and well-being of players, and always representing the school professionally.
Qualifications: Minimum of 3 years coaching experience (head coaching preferred) Proven coaching techniques and in-depth knowledge, including rules, strategies, and district and PIAA regulations Strong communication, organizational, and leadership skills Ability to foster effective relationships with administrators, staff, students, parents, and governing bodies Commitment to academic and personal development of student-athletes Ability to assess and develop players and coaches Professional demeanor and motivational leadership Effective communicator with strong human relations skills Commitment to equity, diversity, and inclusion Willingness to uphold school policies and work flexible hours, including evenings and weekends Availability to meet with students and parents outside of instructional hours A head coach/assistant coach must be dedicated to organizing and maintaining a structured off-season workout program that supports the ongoing development of their athletes. This involves planning and supervising conditioning, skill-building, and strength training sessions to ensure progress throughout the year and team readiness.
Application Process: All required clearances must comply with the Pennsylvania Department of Education's mandated criteria for hire. Questions may be directed to the Athletics Department at 717-270-6770 or asinico@lebanon.k12.pa.us All required clearances must comply with the Pennsylvania Department of Education's mandated criteria for hire.
Application Deadline: The position will remain open until the appropriate candidate is selected.
The Lebanon School District is an equal-opportunity employer.
Job.Location: District Wide, 1000 South 8th St, Lebanon, PA 17042
Job.Experience: Minimum of 3 years coaching experience (head coaching preferred)

Job.JobTitle: Track and Field - Varsity Head Coach
Job.JobDescription:
NORTH HILLS SCHOOL DISTRICT AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER As required by North Hills Education Association Contract Article XVII, Section B, the following coaching vacancy is posted for the 2025-2026 school year:
POSITION: The North Hills School District is seeking a Varsity Head Track and Field Coach
QUALIFICATIONS: Demonstrated successful experience coaching at the high school or collegiate level (head coaching experience preferred). Comprehensive knowledge of track and field, meet planning, and program organization. Commitment to fostering academic success, sportsmanship, leadership, and character in student-athletes. Excellent communication and organizational skills. Ability to build positive relationships with students, staff, parents, and community members. All required clearances in accordance with Pennsylvania state law.
RESPONSIBILITIES: Lead and oversee all aspects of the varsity track and field program, including staff selection, and meet preparation. Coordinate off-season strength and conditioning programs. Promote the varsity track and field program within the school and community. Ensure compliance with all district, WPIAL, and PIAA policies and regulations.
SALARY: Minimum $5,600 annual stipend with increase based upon previous coaching experience

The Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach at Southside High is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Southside High reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Varsity Football - Assistant Adjunct Coach may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Southside High. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.

Job Summary Direct and evaluate the learning experiences of students in both curricular and extracurricular activities and is responsible for the supervision of the entire volleyball program (varsity, junior varsity, and B-team). Coaching Responsibilities: Work with the athletic director to establish a yearly budget for area of responsibility. Ensure compliance with all Horry County policies concerning athletics. Ensure compliance with all South Carolina High School League rules and regulations as well as region rules and regulations. Discuss all problems with the athletic director. Create an exciting and interesting program that will attract student athletes and increase student body and community spirit. Create a program which will monitor grades and behavior of student athletes. Work with the athletic director to hire all staff for the volleyball program. Make sure all facilities in program are safe, clean, and well managed year-round. Create a system which will allow staff to grow in all phases of coaching to include pre- and post-season conferences. Communicate effectively to the parents and community the vision for the volleyball programs. Prepare yearly pre- and post-season inventory sheets. Work directly with the strength coach to establish in-season, out-of-season, and summer workout programs. Work with college recruiters to place as many student athletes as possible. Other Duties Performs any other related duties as assigned by the Principal or other appropriate administrator that serve to promote the social and academic well-being of students. Job Specifications To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Minimum Qualifications (Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required) 1. Must have at least a high school diploma or higher. REQUIRED 2. The candidate must have a minimum of 3 years of successful coaching experience. 3. Communicate effectively through both verbal and written communication. 4. Such alternatives to the above qualifications as the board may find appropriate and acceptable. 5. Must complete all NFHS and Horry County Schools coaching readiness requirements. 6. Must have current CPR/AED certification or willing to obtain certification prior to employment. Physical Requirements The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand and reach with hands and arms; walk; sit; stoop or kneel; crouch or crawl. Duties may involve risk resulting from attending to students' behavioral, physical or sanitation/hygiene needs. Individual should be able to hear and understand speech at normal levels and on the telephone and, speak in audible tones so that others may understand clearly in person and on the telephone. Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Pay Grade: Supplemental Pay Only This job description in no way states or implies that these are the only duties to be performed by this employee. The employee will be required to follow any other instructions and to perform any other related duties as assigned by the appropriate administrator or supervisor. Horry County Schools reserves the right to update, revise or change this job description and related duties at any time without prior notice.
Job.Experience: minimum of 3 years of successful coaching experience

No compensation will be awarded for time worked before an application and cleared background check are received by the Office of Human Resources. TB test administered over one year ago will not be accepted) Additional Information: - School Websites - Salary Scales The deadline is for the convenience of the District. Foster effective communication with parents and/or guardians. 6. Provide for the care and protection of school property. 7. Cooperate with and participate in the planning, implementation and evaluation of the total school program. 8. Participate in professional development activities. 9. Responsible for the care and welfare of the school and student body. Coaching Responsibilities: 1. Work with the athletic director to establish a yearly budget for area of responsibility. 2. Ensure compliance with all Horry County policies concerning athletics. 3. Create a system which will allow staff to grow in all phases of coaching to include pre- and post-season conferences. 10. Work directly with the strength coach to establish in-season, out-of-season, and summer workout programs. 13. Work with college recruiters to place as many student athletes as possible. Job.JobTitle: 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High
Job.JobDescription:
The 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High role at Stratford High is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Stratford High are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Stratford High, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee- Head JV Softball Coach- Stratford High at Stratford High, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.

Emergency procedures are understood and practiced so that the team is prepared if an unexpected situation occurs.
This position is well suited to coaches who are detail‑oriented, who enjoy planning and facilitating engaging practices, and who care about the long‑term lessons students take away from their time in athletics. Serving as the 2025-2026 Temporary Employee - Head Boys B-Team Baseball Coach - Stratford High at Stratford High allows a coach to influence not only competitive outcomes, but also the habits and character of the next generation.

Position Type: Athletics/Extra-curricular/Athletic Coach Date Posted: 7/1/2025 Location: Lexington County School District One Position Title: Coach Department: Student Services Reports To: Principal/Athletic Director FLSA Status: Not applicable REQUIRED EDUCATION AND/OR EXPERIENCE: Experience as a participant or coach of the assigned sport; or any equivalent combination of training and experience which provides the required knowledge, skills and abilities CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS: Must have current government issued identification TERMS OF EMPLOYMENT: Seasonal part-time Athletics Salary Schedule The terms of employment detailed in this job description are based on full time employment during the school year. Conditions of employment may be adjusted for part time employees or individuals who are hired for less than an entire school year. GENERAL SUMMARY: Under general supervision of the athletic director, instructs students in a sport to obtain a high skill level, an appreciation of discipline and sportsmanship, and increased self-esteem. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Supports and upholds the mission, vision and strategic goals of Lexington County School District One towards increased outcomes for students. Interacts, communicates and collaborates with all stakeholders effectively. Establishes a safe, supportive, positive and productive working and learning environment. Operates general office and technology equipment needed for daily activities. Maintains confidentiality regarding all employee and student information. Participates in all professional meetings and training sessions as required. Requests and maintains materials needed for daily responsibilities and essential functions; provides for safe storage and proper use of all tools, equipment and materials. Explains and demonstrates use of apparatus and equipment. Explains and demonstrates principles, techniques, and methods of regulating movement of the body, hands, or feet to achieve proficiency in activity. Plans and schedules a regular program of practice; observes students during practice to detect and correct mistakes. Explains and enforces safety rules and regulations. Oversees the safety conditions of the facility or area in which assigned sport is conducted. Explains methods of keeping score. Organizes and conducts competitions and tournaments. Works closely with the athletic director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests and in assuring adequate publicity for the assigned sport. Establishes and enforces performance criteria for eligibility in interscholastic competition in each assigned sport. Enforces discipline and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establishes and oversees penalties for breach of such standards by individual students. Recommends purchase of equipment, supplies, and uniforms as appropriate to the athletic director. Assumes responsibility as assigned for maintaining equipment, storage areas, and playing areas for assigned sport. Assumes responsibility for students at all times during the school day and supervises students on the grounds as assigned by the principal. Meets with parents, administrators and school counselors as needed to discuss student performance, activities, etc. Performs other job-related duties as assigned SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITY: Responsible for athletic equipment and facilities. Supervises students participating in sport being coached. OTHER SKILLS AND ABILITIES: Ability to perform duties with awareness of all district requirements and Lexington County School District One Board policies. Must be able to access reliable transportation. Knowledge of the policies, procedures, and activities of the school district which pertain to the specific duties and responsibilities of the position. Knowledge of school policies, procedures, and operations. Ability to demonstrate proper maintenance, safe operation, and utilization of equipment, materials, and supplies used in daily activities. Ability to maintain high standards of accuracy in exercising duties. Ability to anticipate work to be completed and to complete work without the need for direct supervision. Ability to maintain confidentiality of employee and student records and information. Ability to interact and communicate in an effective and professional manner with supervisors, co-workers, teachers, students, and the general public. Personal computer experience required. Strong knowledge of word processing, e-mail, spreadsheets, electronic file management, the internet, and reporting and presentation software. Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with students, staff and the school community. Ability to speak clearly and concisely both in oral and written communication. Ability to apply knowledge and current research and theory. Ability to organize and implement a flexible work schedule in order to meet reporting deadlines. Ability to self-monitor and manage multiple tasks while working individually and with members of a group. Ability to submit all requested reports and documentation in a timely manner and in accordance with scheduled deadlines. Some extended hours and multiple demands from several people are frequently required of the employee. Computer literacy required.

The Head Varsity Boys Volleyball Coach role at Summerville High School is focused on building a competitive, well‑organized program that still prioritizes the overall well‑being of student‑athletes. This position blends strategy, culture‑building, and teaching, providing the coach with an opportunity to influence the direction of the program for years to come. The successful candidate will bring a clear vision for how to teach the sport, how to manage a team, and how to represent the school in a positive and professional manner.
From a competitive standpoint, the Head Varsity Boys Volleyball Coach is responsible for developing seasonal plans that align practice content, conditioning work, and game preparation. This includes designing practice segments that progress from individual fundamentals to full‑team tactical execution. The coach should be comfortable breaking down film, identifying areas for improvement, and communicating game plans in a way that athletes can understand and apply under pressure.
Equally important is the culture created by the coach. At Summerville High School, teams are expected to demonstrate sportsmanship, respect, and unity. The Head Varsity Boys Volleyball Coach sets standards for effort in practice, behavior in the classroom, and conduct in the community. That might involve establishing team guidelines, leading discussions about values, and recognizing athletes who demonstrate leadership or growth in those areas. The goal is to build a program where success is measured not just by wins and losses but by the quality of the experience for everyone involved.
This position also involves close coordination with the academic side of the school. The coach monitors eligibility, encourages students to keep up with assignments, and celebrates academic milestones. Communicating with teachers and counselors when necessary helps support student‑athletes as whole people, not just as performers in one activity. At Summerville High School, the Head Varsity Boys Volleyball Coach is viewed as part of the educational team.
Program administration tasks include managing equipment and uniforms, tracking inventory, assisting with scheduling, and following all district and league regulations. The coach should be organized, punctual, and attentive to details such as transportation arrangements and roster paperwork. Safety protocols, including emergency action planning and injury‑reporting procedures, must be consistently followed.
Overall, the Head Varsity Boys Volleyball Coach at Summerville High School is best suited for a coach who is excited about teaching, willing to collaborate with colleagues, and prepared to invest in the growth of student‑athletes over multiple seasons. It is an opportunity to provide structure, challenge, and support while representing the school with pride in the larger athletic community.

Position Title: Coach, Assistant Department: Athletics Reports To: Head Coach SUMMARY: To help each participating student achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: Assists the head coach in any assigned duties related to football in addition to coaching the Varsity team. Assumes responsibility for checking all practice areas each day and removes hazardous objects from the practice area. Helps develop a positive public relations program in the school and the community. Assists the head coach in developing a well-organized practice schedule that maximizes practice time and develops student-athlete skill in football. Assists the head coach in working with athletics director to develop a competitive yearly game schedule. Assists the head coach in completing and submitting all required AHSAA and local system reports in a timely manner. Assists the head coach in developing and implementing an effective scouting program. Attends all staff meetings, clinics, and other professional development activities. Assists the head coach in implementing an effective injury prevention and care program. Assists the head coach in developing and implementing an effective strength and conditioning program. Assists the head coach in ensuring that all football activities are in compliance with AHSAA and local system policies and procedures. Assists the head coach in maintaining a current inventory of all football equipment, supplies and materials. Assists the head coach in developing and implementing an effective off-season program. Assists the head coach in working with the athletics director to ensure that all football facilities are properly maintained. Assists the head coach in working with the athletics director to develop and implement an effective fund-raising program. Performs other duties as assigned by the head coach and/or athletics director. QUALIFICATIONS: High School Diploma or GED required. Experience as a football coach at the high school or college level preferred. Must possess effective coaching techniques and skills. Must possess knowledge of the rules, regulations, strategies, and techniques of football. Must possess the ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with school administrators, parents, and students. Must be able to communicate effectively both orally and in writing. Must be able to work independently and with others. Must be able to work evenings and weekends. Must be able to travel as required. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to stand; walk; sit; use hands to finger, handle, or feel; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance; stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear; and taste or smell. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, color vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to outside weather conditions. The employee is occasionally exposed to wet and/or humid conditions; moving mechanical parts; high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals; extreme cold; extreme heat; risk of electrical shock; explosives; risk of radiation; and vibration. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Term of Employment: Seasonal Athletic Supplements Pay Scale Evaluation: Performance of this job will be evaluated annually according to Board Policy. The information contained in this job description is for compliance with the American with Disabilities Act (A.D.A.) and is not an exhaustive list of the duties performed for this position. Additional duties are performed by the individuals currently holding this position and additional duties may be assigned. Updated 2019
Job.Location: SOUTH AIKEN HIGH SCHOOL - Aiken, South Carolina
Job.CompanyDescription: Aiken County Public Sch. coaching jobs

Job.JobDescription:
POSITION PURPOSE: Prepares each participating student athlete for competition in sports activities, and helps them to achieve a high level of skill, an appreciation for the values of discipline and sportsmanship, and an increased level of self-esteem.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Prioritize athletics as a supplemental program to support the academic mission of the school. Carry out the aims and objectives of the sports program as outlined by the Athletic Director and school district administration. Instruct athletes in individual and team fundamentals, sportsmanship, cooperation, strategy and playing tactics, and physical conditioning necessary to realize individual and team success. Assist the Athletic Director in scheduling intramural and interscholastic contests. Assist in planning and scheduling a regular program of practice in season. Maintain required attendance forms, insurance records, and other related documents. Assist in oversight of safety conditions in the facility or area in which the assigned sport is conducted at all times student athletes are present. Assist in establishing and implementing performance criteria for academic eligibility in interscholastic competition of the identified sport. Enforce code of conduct standards and sportsmanlike behavior at all times; establish and oversee penalties for breach of standards by student athletes. Recommend purchase of equipment, supplies, uniforms, etc. as appropriate.
ADDITIONAL DUTIES: Performs other related tasks as assigned by the Athletic Director, Principal, Superintendent or other district office administrator as designated by the Superintendent.
QUALIFICATIONS: Previous successful coaching experience in assigned sport. Knowledge and/or background in the assigned sport. Teaching certificate and experience preferred. Must be able to pass criminal background check. Valid drivers license.
EXPERIENCE: Must have knowledge of South Carolina High School League rules and eligibility. Must be cooperative, service-oriented, and able to work effectively with frequent interruptions.

Job.JobTitle: Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School
Job.JobDescription:
The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School position at Nation Ford High School is an opportunity to shape a positive, inclusive, and hardworking team environment where students learn to love their sport and take pride in representing their school. This role emphasizes relationship‑building, clear expectations, and steady improvement over the course of a season and across multiple years of participation. The coach serves as a daily presence in the lives of student‑athletes, modeling the type of attitude and work ethic that leads to both athletic and personal growth.
At the core of the job is teaching. The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School is responsible for breaking down complex skills into manageable steps, offering demonstrations, and creating drills that allow athletes to practice safely and effectively. Practices should be organized around clear objectives, with time built in for warm‑up, instruction, repetition, and review. The coach gives frequent feedback, adjusts activities based on what athletes need, and encourages questions so that students remain engaged in their learning.
The role also involves nurturing team chemistry and a sense of belonging. At Nation Ford High School, coaches work to make sure every athlete feels included and respected. That means setting guidelines that prevent negative behavior, addressing conflicts quickly and fairly, and celebrating contributions from both starters and role players. The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School encourages athletes to support one another, communicate openly, and take pride in representing their school with class.
Beyond the field, court, track, or pool, the coach collaborates with school staff to support student‑athletes as whole people. That includes reinforcing academic expectations, respecting school policies, and helping students manage the demands of both athletics and coursework. Regular contact with families keeps everyone informed about schedules, expectations, and program goals, and offers a consistent channel for questions or concerns.
The Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School also participates in broader program responsibilities such as attending department meetings, assisting with youth outreach or clinics, and contributing to long‑term planning. The coach is expected to stay current with best practices in training, injury prevention, and sport‑specific strategy, and to maintain any certifications required by the district or state association.
For individuals who enjoy working with young people, who believe in the value of school‑based athletics, and who are prepared to invest time in building a healthy team culture, the Boys Volleyball JV Assistant Coach - High School role at Nation Ford High School is a meaningful and impactful opportunity.
Job.Location: Nation Ford High School - Fort Mill, South Carolina

Job.JobDescription:
The Girls' Soccer Coach - Middle School at Springfield Middle School is a comprehensive coaching role that combines instruction, mentorship, and program management. This long‑form description reflects the multifaceted nature of school coaching, where the coach is both a technical expert and a caring adult presence in the lives of student‑athletes. The position is ideal for someone who values structure, communication, and collaboration while maintaining a clear focus on student development.
Day to day, the Girls' Soccer Coach - Middle School plans and leads practices that prioritize safety, learning, and steady improvement. A typical session might include dynamic warm‑ups, small‑group drills, competitive games, and review conversations that help athletes understand why they are working on certain skills. The coach explains expectations clearly, uses age‑appropriate language, and adapts instruction so that athletes at different experience levels can participate and progress.
Another key element of the job is fostering positive habits. Coaches at Springfield Middle School reinforce punctuality, preparedness, and respectful communication. The Girls' Soccer Coach - Middle School expects athletes to bring the proper equipment, to listen when others are speaking, and to take responsibility for their effort and behavior. When mistakes occur, the coach responds with guidance and accountability rather than embarrassment, reinforcing that learning is an ongoing process.
The role also emphasizes alignment with the school’s mission. Athletics is treated as part of the educational program, not as a separate or higher priority. That means the Girls' Soccer Coach - Middle School supports academic expectations, respects teachers’ roles, and encourages athletes to manage their time effectively. By checking in on grades and reinforcing eligibility requirements, the coach helps students see the connection between their everyday decisions and their opportunities to compete.
Operationally, the position involves logistics such as coordinating with transportation, ensuring facilities are left in good condition, communicating schedules, and maintaining equipment inventories. The coach understands district policies, league rules, and safety procedures, and follows them consistently. Maintaining required certifications and participating in professional development keeps the coach informed about best practices in training and athlete welfare.
In addition, the Girls' Soccer Coach - Middle School may contribute to long‑term program building through youth clinics, off‑season activities, and collaboration with other levels of the program. By investing in relationships with families and younger athletes, the coach helps sustain interest and continuity in the sport at Springfield Middle School. Candidates who enjoy balancing big‑picture planning with day‑to‑day teaching will find this position engaging and fulfilling.
Job.Location: Springfield Middle School - Fort Mill, South Carolina

The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 role at Dutch Fork High School is focused on helping student‑athletes unlock their potential through intentional coaching, structured practice environments, and a strong emphasis on character. This description outlines a position in which the coach is expected to be a planner, a teacher, a mentor, and a positive representative of the school community. Successful candidates bring energy to practices, patience to instruction, and clarity to expectations.
Practices form the backbone of the program, and the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 is responsible for designing sessions that are purposeful and efficient. Each practice should have defined goals, from teaching new concepts to reinforcing previously learned skills or preparing for upcoming competition. The coach uses a variety of drills and teaching methods to keep athletes engaged, and regularly evaluates whether the team is progressing in the desired areas.
Coaches at Dutch Fork High School are also trusted to guide student‑athletes through challenges. That can include addressing frustrations after a tough loss, helping a student handle the pressure of increased responsibility, or supporting someone who is balancing school, family, and activities. The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 listens, provides perspective, and reinforces the idea that effort, attitude, and resilience are as important as any statistical outcome.
Communication is a key strength of this position. The coach shares information about schedules, team policies, and expectations with families and staff in a timely and professional way. Within the team, the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 encourages athletes to ask questions, give feedback, and support one another. This open communication helps prevent misunderstandings and builds trust.
Safety and compliance cannot be overlooked. The Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 follows all relevant policies regarding equipment, supervision, travel, and emergency procedures. The coach maintains current certifications as required and keeps up with best practices around conditioning, concussion awareness, and hydration. At Dutch Fork High School, the well‑being of student‑athletes is non‑negotiable.
This role is a good match for coaches who appreciate structure, care deeply about students, and are committed to building a consistent, values‑driven program. By serving as the Volleyball - Varsity Head Coach - 2026 at Dutch Fork High School, a coach has the opportunity to make a lasting impact on young people while contributing to a respected and sustainable athletic tradition.
