Job.JobTitle: Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys
Job.JobDescription:
The Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys position at Dutch Fork High School provides an opportunity to guide student‑athletes through an experience that combines challenge, support, and growth. This role is intended for coaches who see beyond wins and losses and who value the lasting impact that a positive athletic program can have on young people. Through careful planning, consistent expectations, and ongoing communication, the coach helps create a framework where athletes can thrive.
From an instructional perspective, the Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys prepares practices that sequence learning effectively. Early sessions may focus heavily on fundamentals and basic systems, while later practices refine execution and introduce more advanced concepts. The coach uses demonstrations, targeted drills, and guided scrimmages to help athletes apply what they learn. Regular assessment allows the coach to adjust plans based on the team’s progress.
The position also requires deliberate attention to team culture. At Dutch Fork High School, the Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys works to ensure that the environment is welcoming, fair, and focused on collective responsibility. The coach sets expectations around effort, communication, and respect, and follows through when those expectations are not met. Celebrating positive examples and giving athletes leadership opportunities strengthens the sense of ownership within the group.
Support for the broader student experience is built into the job. Coaches stay informed about academic calendars, test periods, and other school events so that practices and competitions are scheduled thoughtfully whenever possible. The Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys encourages athletes to communicate about conflicts in advance and to take initiative in managing their commitments. When students feel supported in both academics and athletics, they are more likely to remain engaged and successful.
Administrative responsibilities include coordination with the athletic department, assisting with transportation, submitting required paperwork, and maintaining accurate rosters. The coach must be attentive to detail and willing to complete these tasks reliably, as they directly affect the experience of athletes and families.
At its core, the Golf - Junior Varsity Head Coach - Boys at Dutch Fork High School is a chance to teach, to mentor, and to build something that extends beyond a single season. Candidates who are motivated by the opportunity to help students grow through sport will find this position especially meaningful.

Reports To: School Athletic Director and/or School Administration Job Summary: Rock Hill Schools is seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Athletic Coach to lead, motivate, and develop athletes to reach their highest potential in both skill and character. The Athletic Coach will plan and implement practice sessions, guide athletes in training and competition, promote teamwork and sportsmanship, and ensure the health and safety of all participants. Key Responsibilities: Develop and execute effective training programs and practice plans. Instruct athletes in the rules, techniques, and strategies of the sport. Evaluate athlete performance and provide constructive feedback. Foster a positive team culture that emphasizes discipline, effort, integrity, and mutual respect. Ensure adherence to all rules and regulations set by the school, league, or governing body. Monitor the physical and mental condition of athletes, including injury prevention and first response. Coordinate with assistant coaches, athletic trainers, and other staff. Communicate regularly with athletes, parents, and administration. Attend all practices, games, meetings, and required events. Maintain equipment and inventory related to the specific sport. Serve as a role model and mentor to student-athletes. Qualifications: Proven coaching experience in [specific sport, e.g., basketball, soccer, track, etc.]. Knowledge of sport-specific techniques, rules, and strategies. Excellent leadership, motivational, and organizational skills. Strong interpersonal and communication abilities. Satisfactory background report Preferred: Experience coaching at the [high school/collegiate/professional] level. Relevant coaching certification (e.g., NFHS, USA Coaching, etc.) Start Date: Determined by Human Resources. PRE-ONBOARDING REQUIREMENTS: As a condition of employment and prior to onboarding, the district will conduct a criminal history background check. The recommended candidate will be required to provide personal information necessary to complete the background check such as date of birth, gender, and race to remain in compliance with applicable laws and regulations. DISCLAIMER: The District reserves the right to modify job postings and/or job descriptions at any time to meet organizational needs. EEOC STATEMENT: Rock Hill Schools provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. Job Requirements: Citizenship, residency or work visa required
